getChoices

java.lang.String[] getChoices(User user)
Get the choices.

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
The choices or null if the driver does not know the choices.

write

Status write(User user,
             int value,
             int mask)
Write a value.

Parameters:
user - The user.
value - The value.
mask - Bit mask specifying the bits to modify.
Returns:
The status.

read

Status read(User user,
            int mask)
Read a value.

Parameters:
user - The user.
mask - Bit mask specifying the bits to modify.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success or Status.timeout than user.message() describes the problem. If successful user.getInt() returns the value. All bits corresponding to 0 values in the mask will be 0.

setInterrupt

Status setInterrupt(User user,
                    int mask,
                    DigitalInterruptReason reason)
Write a value.

Parameters:
user - The user.
mask - The bits which can cause an interrupt.
reason - The reason for raising an interrupt.
Returns:
The status.

getInterrupt

Status getInterrupt(User user,
                    int mask,
                    DigitalInterruptReason reason)
Get each bit that is set for reason.

Parameters:
user - The user.
mask - The bits which can cause an interrupt.
reason - The reason for raising an interrupt.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success or Status.timeout than user.message() describes the problem. If successful user.getInt() returns the interrupt mask.

clearInterrupt

Status clearInterrupt(User user,
                      int mask)
Clear outstanding interrupts.

Parameters:
user - The user.
mask - The bits that may have caused an interrupt.
Returns:
The status.

                        UInt32DigitalInterruptListener uint32DigitalInterruptListener,
                        int mask)
Register a listener for value changes.

Parameters:
user - The user.
uint32DigitalInterruptListener - The listener interface.
mask - Bit mask specifying the bits for which to interrupt.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success than user.message() describes the problem.

Parameters:
user - The user.
uint32DigitalInterruptListener - The listener interface.
Returns:
The status. If the status is not Status.success than user.message() describes the problem.
